daisy.preferred_weather: Mild temperatures, thrives in cool weather

care_tips.watering: Water regularly, but allow the soil to dry out between waterings. Water deeply once a week.
care_tips.sunlight: Prefers full sun but can tolerate partial shade.
care_tips.placement: Plant in well-drained soil with plenty of sunlight.
care_tips.extra_tips: Deadhead spent flowers to encourage more blooms. Daisies are fairly low-maintenance and resistant to pests.

daisy.interesting_fact: Daisies symbolize purity and innocence, often seen in gardens and as cut flowers.

care_tips.watering: Water moderately, once the soil starts to dry out.
care_tips.sunlight: Thrives in full sun, but can tolerate partial shade.
care_tips.placement: Dandelions grow well in a variety of soils, from lawns to wild meadows.
care_tips.extra_tips: Dandelions can spread quickly by seed, so consider managing their growth if theyâ€™re in a garden.

dandelion.interesting_fact: The entire plant is edible, and dandelions are rich in vitamins A, C, and K.

rose.preferred_weather: Warm to hot temperatures, needs plenty of sunlight

care_tips.watering: Water deeply once a week, more frequently in hot weather, but avoid getting the leaves wet to prevent disease.
care_tips.sunlight: Roses require at least 6 hours of direct sunlight per day.
care_tips.placement: Plant in well-draining soil with good air circulation to avoid fungal diseases.
care_tips.extra_tips: Prune dead or diseased branches regularly and fertilize during the growing season to encourage strong blooms.

rose.interesting_fact: Roses are one of the oldest flowers cultivated by humans, dating back over 5,000 years.

sunflower.most_blooms_month: Summer, typically from July to September

care_tips.watering: Water regularly, especially during dry spells, but allow the soil to dry out slightly between waterings.
care_tips.sunlight: Needs full sun to thrive and produce large blooms.
care_tips.placement: Plant in nutrient-rich, well-draining soil with plenty of sunlight.
care_tips.extra_tips: Sunflowers are tall plants that may need staking to support their growth. Ensure they have enough space to grow.

sunflower.interesting_fact: Sunflowers are not only beautiful but are also used to produce edible seeds and oil.
